note: > moveNumOfMonths("2017-10-30",-1) [1] "2017-09-30" Back two months: > moveNumOfMonths("2017-10-30",-2) [1] "2017-08-30" Forward two months:

title: Because November has 30 days, we get the same date in the backward operation, but: > moveNumOfMonths("2017-01-30"
Lubridate provides ymd() series of functions for parsing character strings into dates. The letters y, m, and d correspond to the year, month, and day elements of a date-time
tz = "UTC") # Returns a vector of class POSIXt ## "2016-07-21 UTC
